definition: full of sap (idiom); young and vigorous
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

square/power or involution (math.)/upright/honest/fair and square/direction/side/party (to a contract, dispute etc)/place/method/prescription (medicine)/just when/only or just/classifier for square things/abbr. for square or cubic meter

sentences.english: They are more courageous than older men and their hot temper prevents fear.
sentences.chinese: 比起老年人來，他們血氣方剛，熱情使他們毫無畏懼。

sentences.english: But everything here calls for solitude and the blood of young men.
sentences.chinese: 但在這裏的每樣事物都召喚孤獨和血氣方剛的年輕人。

voice change (at puberty)/to alter one's voice (deliberately)/to sound different (when angry etc)
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end

definition: lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
full of youthful vigor (idiom)/in the prime of youth
devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
(of parents) to bring up children for the purpose of being looked after in old age
